thread.title: NYPD officer shot, killed
thread.title_full: NYPD officer shot, killed - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: NYPD officer shot, killed
text:
(RNN) – A New York Police Department officer shot on Tuesday night has died, according to the NYPD.
The officer has been identified by the department as Randolph Holder, 33, a five-year veteran of the force. He was shot in East Harlem while responding to reports of a man with a gun, according to a NYPD tweet.
At least one suspect is in custody, police said.
Join us in praying for NYPD Police Officer Randolph Holder and his family. pic.twitter.com/OjdLqFYo7r
— NYPD NEWS (@NYPDnews) October 21, 2015 The officer was shot in the head, and the suspect suffered a leg wound, WABC-TV said.
He was the fourth officer killed in New York City in 11 months, NYC Police Commissioner William J. Bratton said.
